channel.title: There is a possible way to develop on scar
channel.description:
There is a possible way to develop on scar.
Is anyone willing to ask Kaitnieks for the source code or at least decompiling it?
It's been almost 6 or 7 months, it would be nice if we knew that 'someone' was working on SCAR. And it is possible, we just need to decompile it and read through the source code and try to understand it. Anyone willing to do either decompile or ask for the source?
~Ron

item.title: There is a possible way to develop on scar
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I haven’t changed at all, for example I released the moparscape revolution updater, SIDE, and all my deobs after MoparScape 3.0 was released. And when/if MoparScape 4.0 ever gets released 3.0 would then become opensource.

Read full topic

Starblaster100:

Remember, you also did that on your site, and didn’t want me to remove private scripts.

Mopar didn’t allow you to remove mine hopefully we all learned a lesson? Mine were here for over 3 months until the aryan forums were removed. We all hopefully regret the turn of events before and after. However they were removed from my site, nerice handled it and made Neonknight apologize. It wont happen again.

pwnd:

I wasn’t G-Mod at the time. I don’t think it’d matter anyways. Not to many people like you at all…

I wasn’t talking about you.

eXemplar, so only regex profited?

mopar:

The current MoparScape is not opensource, EVERYTHING else I have ever written is, including all past versions of MoparScape and the MoparScape Revolution updater.

exactly you have seen the issues with open source and changed.

item.title: There is a possible way to develop on scar
item.dc:creator: @eXemplar eXemplar
item.description:
@eXemplar wrote:

eXemplar -- i think you might be confusing what ruler wants to sell here. hes not selling anything thats an edit of jagex's java client so he has the intellectual rights to the software. and you didnt answer " Would you release a bot open source that was everlasting?"
No I have no idea what ruler wants to sell here, because I'm not talking directly about whatever you're currently working on. Please reread my revised statement =p
Why didn't you release your private aryan? I talked to one customers of your private aryan before you guy stopped selling, so i do know you sold some Smiley. RegeX never let me buy
Because we all stopped working on it for some reason at that point, regex picked it up and sold a few on the side but no-one else really had anything to do with that.
Open source usually constitutes as free.
Not necessarily, it all depends on the open source license you use (if any).

Read full topic

item.title: There is a possible way to develop on scar
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

ruler:

This from a illegal distrbutor of my pay to use sbot3 scripts. Hey, at least your honest and dont hide in the shadows about your activites, we share that.

Open source usually constitutes as free.

Leaking it would only hurt their business. however i didn't know a g-mod (not pwnd) from this site would cross-me.
I wasn't G-Mod at the time. I don't think it'd matter anyways. Not to many people like you [b]at all.[/b].
Also i would like to point out that aryan was not open source, it required a updater.
Hahahaahahaha.
GenoDemoN:

" Would you release a bot open source that was everlasting?"

I’m just going to assume your mom dropped you on your head right after she did with ruler. That’s like saying I gave you a cupcake, but it wasn’t free.

Read full topic
item.source: There is a possible way to develop on scar

item.title: There is a possible way to develop on scar
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

eXemplar:

[quote]Before aryan, members on your team would crack other peoples work. Cracking and rippping push things closed source. Also i see scar includes as a open source but you said “worth using”.

I have found out people that were part of the aryan dev team, pre-developing aryan would crack other peoples bots. I am sure cracking and ripping influences current contributors to stop and disuades would-be/future contributors from contributing. This ripping/cracking has a even more detrimental effect on the people who purchase a product.

Ok, well lets talk about who’s in the wrong here, eh ? People were attempting to sell/profit from works based off blatant copyright infringements. Not that I’m saying two wrongs make a right, but I can definately justify said ‘cracking’ in these situations. I am sure making a profit off desperate kiddies and isolating/abusing others is way more detrimental than someone’s loss of a few fraudelent payments. If some people can have a bot, why can’t everyone ? If you’re making bots to support yourself in any way, well you’re probably in the wrong line of work buddy. My greatest gripe has been with people hoarding/hiding what they do purely for self benefit.

I doubt there was anything that was open to be pushed closed, either.

Also i see scar includes as a open source but you said “worth using”.

Yes, well while some of the scar scripts could be considered as open source, they are still just an addon to a closed source program. And in my opinion, scar went straight down the tube once Kait implemented this signing of scripts so people can’t see the source and sell the scripts. Don’t get me wrong though, it’s still a great program and I even use it from time to time (great for cheating at those online flash games ;-)). Also, don’t get me wrong, I’m not some sort of, “open source holy roller, YOU MUST GIEV SOURCE OK,” but I do have something against what I mentioned in the previous paragraph.

As far as the ripping goes, who cares if people ‘rip’ your works ? If what you’ve made has been ripped, it just goes to show that you’ve made something at least half decent and a few other people have gotten use out of it too. I think the old saying goes something like this, “Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery.” Sure, it might be nice to get recognition, but if that’s what you worry about when you release something, but I’m pretty sure it’d be next to worthless coming from someone who would rip it.

Mad e-props son.[/quote]

Wow, I agree 100% with everything eXemplar said in the post, great job.

ruler:

Mopar you not open-source however you are pro-leech so long as the leechers are benfiting you.

The current MoparScape is not opensource, EVERYTHING else I have ever written is, including all past versions of MoparScape and the MoparScape Revolution updater.

Read full topic

Remember, you also did that on your site, and didn’t want me to remove private scripts.

item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“eXemplar, post:64, topic:20622”]Uhh, runescape is a copyrighted work duder.

Why shouldn’t everyone be able to bot ? Why should a few selfish people profit to the detriment of everyone else ? There’s a big difference between communism and fascism, and stopping a few greedy pricks profiteering over something as pointless as a java mud.

You can do whatever you want with it, I dun’ care. I just hoped that some people could benefit from it a little.[/quote]
would you prefer it a 202 client based on your stuff be open source? very simple.

item.title: There is a possible way to develop on scar
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

eXemplar, i was not aware of copyright infringment, your saying the bots that were cracked were just rip off of yours?

eXemplar, i dont agree with giving kids a free bot at all cost. Espcially since most customers of pay to use bots are generally old and are for pure profit. Just bc one has something doesn’t mean all should have it. Your politics are very confusing on one hand your a communist and on the other your a hitler fascist. Why didn’t you release your private aryan? I talked to one customers of your private aryan before you guy stopped selling, so i do know you sold some :). RegeX never let me buy

Hey eXemplar can i release a rsc client based on your refactored MC 202? of course credited. Should it be open source? Frank_ says it should not be. I want your input bc i think you refactored it?

Also i would like to point out that aryan was not open source, it required a updater. Also it was not ever lasting. Would you release a bot open source that was everlasting?

Mad e-props back at you.

Read full topic

item.title: There is a possible way to develop on scar
item.dc:creator: @eXemplar eXemplar
item.description:
@eXemplar wrote:

Before aryan, members on your team would crack other peoples work. Cracking and rippping push things closed source. Also i see scar includes as a open source but you said "worth using".
I have found out people that were part of the aryan dev team, pre-developing aryan would crack other peoples bots. I am sure cracking and ripping influences current contributors to stop and disuades would-be/future contributors from contributing. This ripping/cracking has a even more detrimental effect on the people who purchase a product.
Ok, well lets talk about who's in the wrong here, eh ? People were attempting to sell/profit from works based off blatant copyright infringements. Not that I'm saying two wrongs make a right, but I can definately justify said 'cracking' in these situations. I am sure making a profit off desperate kiddies and isolating/abusing others is way more detrimental than someone's loss of a few fraudelent payments. If some people can have a bot, why can't everyone ? If you're making bots to support yourself in any way, well you're probably in the wrong line of work buddy. My greatest gripe has been with people hoarding/hiding what they do purely for self benefit.

I doubt there was anything that was open to be pushed closed, either.

Also i see scar includes as a open source but you said "worth using".
Yes, well while some of the scar scripts could be considered as open source, they are still just an addon to a closed source program. And in my opinion, scar went straight down the tube once Kait implemented this signing of scripts so people can't see the source and sell the scripts. Don't get me wrong though, it's still a great program and I even use it from time to time (great for cheating at those online flash games ;-)). Also, don't get me wrong, I'm not some sort of, "open source holy roller, YOU MUST GIEV SOURCE OK," but I do have something against what I mentioned in the previous paragraph.

As far as the ripping goes, who cares if people ‘rip’ your works ? If what you’ve made has been ripped, it just goes to show that you’ve made something at least half decent and a few other people have gotten use out of it too. I think the old saying goes something like this, “Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery.” Sure, it might be nice to get recognition, but if that’s what you worry about when you release something, but I’m pretty sure it’d be next to worthless coming from someone who would rip it.

Mad e-props son.

Read full topic

item.title: There is a possible way to develop on scar
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

Pwnd:

Why would you release something open source and with an authorization system? Are you retarded?

This from a illegal distrbutor of my pay to use sbot3 scripts. Hey, at least your honest and dont hide in the shadows about your activites, we share that. You were and man and didnt deny it, i respect that.

Look i trusted my customers, everyone one of my customers had good rep. Many of them were old sbot3 users who flaxed, it was a grand business. It was in their intrest not to leak it, it was more of a investment. Leaking it would only hurt their business. however i didn’t know a g-mod (not pwnd) from this site would cross-me.

I realize now that its best to sell people who can’t program. “higher-ups” are also the ones who rip/crack…

Read full topic

item.title: There is a possible way to develop on scar
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:55, topic:20622”][quote author=ruler link=topic=31325.msg383033#msg383033 date=1162412923]

i know i just followed triplebla’s awesome guide

hahaha

Ok, I’ll ammend my post,

Before aryan, there was nothing live game related worth using that could remotely be classified ‘open source’ (ie, not leaks or source given out after the fact).

not to flame or anything. Before aryan, members on your team would crack other peoples work. Cracking and rippping push things closed source. Also i see scar includes as a open source but you said “worth using”.
[/quote]

To eXemplar: I know, sad isn’t it? I remember when I did that to lock the camera I just removed the arrow key if statements from the keypressed method, it was horrible

to ruler: Open source would 100% stop cracking and ripping, so what are you talking about?[/quote]

[ul][li] Since you all know i am always looking for conspiracies. I tend to research everyone’s past. I have found out people that were part of the aryan dev team, pre-developing aryan would crack other peoples bots. I am sure cracking and ripping influences current contributors to stop and disuades would-be/future contributors from contributing. This ripping/cracking has a even more detrimental effect on the people who purchase a product.[/li][li] When peoples work gets posted on forums without permission and the site owner doesn’t allow his staff to remove it. It diminishes that persons believe in open source. Example being this site.[/li][li] When people release a bot open source but with auth system, it is easily cracked. Example being this site.[/li][/ul]

I have released many thing open source, i think many of us have and have seen the effects. Mopar you not open-source however you are pro-leech so long as the leechers are benfiting you. Even the Aryan devs stopped being open source, they moved and went completely dark although at one point selling their creations but only for a brief time.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:4, topic:20622”]I honestly think that it should be kept closed source, on a floppy disk, locked in a lead box, in a bunker several hundred meters under the ground

Scar as is, is an excellent program, if it were released several hundred version would popup, many of which would be malicious, or badly coded[/quote]

Agreed.

But everything else should be open source :P.

I still believe winterloves initial release came before aryan, but haven't found a good way to prove it yet. Oh well, so much for old posts.

It did. I confirm.
